page.title: 18Trade
page.content: The Haulage business in the village owned by Alan Blakey and family is involved mainly in agriculture. They have decks that fit on the backs of the wagons to carry sheep and cattle.There is also a trailer which can be towed for this purpose. Cattle and sheep are conveyed to and from marts at Rothbury, Wooler, Acklington,Hexham,Bellingham,Tyneside and sometimes to the Midlands for the Farmers Marketing Corporation. The wagons are regularly used for delivering coal to houses in the area. The coal is usually collected from Shillbottle colliery. The wagons are also used to carry bales of hay and straw, and to convey bales of sheep's wool to the mills in the Scottish Borders.
